bwwExcerpt: If Neil LaBute were to teach a course on playwriting, I bet his lesson plan would look something like this: "Week 1: Dumbing down characters to pad out dialogue and pump up conflict." "Week 2: "Stringing together two-person scenes, no matter how monotonous it gets." "Week 3: Embracing flat, shallow protagonists whose poor life choices are both predictable and banal." And finally, "Week 12: Blasting tracks by Nirvana during changes to simulate tension and edginess." Luckily, there is no Professor
